item.title: Jerry add a quote by Adrian C. Louis
item.description: "I'm at that place I grew up to leave." -- Adrian C. Louis

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Adrian C. Louis
item.description: "Tears upon the dry sponge of heart do not prove I am Promethean." -- Adrian C. Louis

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can warm me, I know that is poetry. If I feel physically as if the top of my head were taken off, I know that is poetry. These are the only ways I know it. Is there any other way?" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "The only emperor is the emperor of ice cream." -- Wallace Stevens

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I have nothing to declare except my genius." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Derek Walcott
item.description:
"But drunkenly, or secretly, we swore, Disciples of that astigmatic saint, That we would never leave the island Until we had put down, in paint, in words, As palmists learn the network of a hand, All of its sunken, leaf-choked ravines, Every neglected, self-pitying inlet Muttering in brackish dialect, the ropes of mangroves From which old soldier crabs slipped Surrendering to slush, Each ochre track seeking some hilltop and Losing itself in an unfinished phrase, Under sand shipyards where the burnt-out palms Inverted the design of unrigged schooners, Entering forests, boiling with life, Goyave, corrosol, bois-canot, sapotille. Days!
The sun drumming, drumming, Past the defeated pennons of the palms, Roads limp from sunstroke, Past green flutes of the grass The ocean cannonading, come! Wonder that opened like the fan Of the dividing fronds On some noon-struck sahara, Where my heart from its rib cage yelped like a pup After clouds of sanderlings rustily wheeling The world on its ancient, Invisible axis, The breakers slow-dolphining over more breakers, To swivel our easels down, as firm As conquerors who had discovered home." -- Derek Walcott

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "I do not know which to prefer, The beauty of inflections Or the beauty of innuendos The blackbird whistling Or just after." -- Wallace Stevens

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Donald Justice
item.description: "Go then, O my inseperable, this once more," -- Donald Justice

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Yamamoto Tsunetomo
item.description: "There is nothing we should be quite so grateful for as the last line of the poem that goes, 'When your own heart asks." -- Yamamoto Tsunetomo

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Li-Young Lee
item.description: "I am that last, that final thing, the body in a white sheet listening," -- Li-Young Lee

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Li-Young Lee
item.description: "We suffer each other to have each other a while." -- Li-Young Lee

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fault always lies in the same place: with him weak enough to lay blame." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Sex is kicking death in the ass while singing." -- Charles Bukowski
